revised_title: Investigating Stereoscopic Illusions and the Role of Semi-Lenses in Refraction
tldr: The author examines the phenomenon of refraction through semi-lenses or prisms and its impact on stereoscopic images. They discover that the refracting stereoscope causes anomalies in the illusion of depth, and explain the cause of this phenomenon, which is a defect detrimental to the beauty and correctness of stereoscopic representations. The author also proposes a new stereoscope design to overcome this issue.
